item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“razorback, post:7, topic:422970”]I’m not confident using throws at all.

It’s a slightly confusing concept to me, I’m not 100% how I would integrate it into my method. If I just put throws IOException after the start of my method will that suffice?[/quote]start here: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/index.html

end here: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/io/File.html

it will help :P. have skype? i will help you further if you want.

did you try

public void theMethod() throws IOException

item.title: Creating/Renaming/Deleting
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“razorback, post:1, topic:422970”]Hey guys.
I’m trying to delete a text file. Then rename another text file. Then create a text file. This is what I have so far, it does not work.

File rename1 = new File("./Data/scores1.txt"); File HS2 = new File("./Data/scores2.txt"); rename1.delete(); HS2.renameTo(rename1); HS2.createNewFile();

All help is appreciated.

Thanks.[/quote]
what you have wont work anyways use try and catch

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/File.html#createNewFile() :

createNewFile public boolean createNewFile() throws IOException Atomically creates a new, empty file named by this abstract pathname if and only if a file with this name does not yet exist. The check for the existence of the file and the creation of the file if it does not exist are a single operation that is atomic with respect to all other filesystem activities that might affect the file. Note: this method should not be used for file-locking, as the resulting protocol cannot be made to work reliably. The FileLock facility should be used instead.

Returns:true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists Throws: IOException - If an I/O error occurred SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its SecurityManager.checkWrite(java.lang.String) method denies write access to the fileSince:1.2

Read full topic

item.title: Creating/Renaming/Deleting
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

Hey guys.
I’m trying to delete a text file. Then rename another text file. Then create a text file. This is what I have so far, it does not work.

File rename1 = new File("./Data/scores1.txt"); File HS2 = new File("./Data/scores2.txt"); rename1.delete(); HS2.renameTo(rename1); HS2.createNewFile();

All help is appreciated.

Thanks.

Read full topic
